title: Regulation (EEC) No 1607/71 of the Commission of 26 July 1971 replacing the German and Dutch terms 'Grütze und Griess' and 'Grutten, gries en griesmeel' in certain Commission Regulations
header:
REGULATION (EEC) No 1607/71 OF THE COMMISSION  of 26 July 1971  replacing the German and Dutch terms "Grütze und Griess" and "Grutten, gries en griesmeel" in certain Commission Regulations
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. In the Dutch texts of Regulation Nos 156/67/EEC 7, 162/67/EEC 8, (EEC) No 559 9, (EEC) No 1060/68 10, (EEC) No 1080/68 11, (EEC) No 1011/70 12, (EEC) No 1796/70 13, (EEC) No 2637/70 14, and (EEC) No 1014/71 15, the terms "gries en griesmeel" shall be substituted for the terms "grutten, gries en griesmeel".
2. In the German texts of Regulations (EEC) Nos 1011/70, 2637/70 and 1014/71, the terms "Grobgriess und Feingriess" shall be substituted for the terms "Grütze und Griess".

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 August 1971.  1OJ No 117, 19.6.1967, p. 2269/67. 2OJ No L 162, 20.7.1971, p. 1. 3OJ No 174, 31.7.1967, p. 36. 4OJ No L 179, 25.7.1968, p. 8. 5OJ No L 162, 20.7.1971, p. 11. 6OJ No L 106, 12.5.1971, p. 1. 7OJ No 128, 27.6.1967, p 2533/67. 8OJ No 128, 27.6.1967, p. 2534/67. 9OJ No L 106, 7.5.1968, p. 6. 10OJ No L 179, 25.7.1968, p. 38. 11OJ No L 181, 27.7.1968, p. 6. 12OJ No L 117, 30.5.1970, p. 54. 13OJ No L 196, 3.9.1970, p. 10. 14OJ No L 283, 29.12.1970, p. 15. 15OJ No L 110, 18.5.1971, p. 10.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 26 July 1971.
For the Commission
The President
Franco M. MALFATTI
